article.headline: UC Irvine 67, Pacific 42
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Patrick Sanders and Mark Kelley each scored 12 points to lead UC Irvine to a 67-42 rout over Pacific on Saturday, handing the Tigers their worst Big West Conference loss since 1990. Darren Fells and Nic Campbell each had 10 points for the Anteaters (8-10, 2-2 Big West), who limited Pacific to 25 percent shooting from the field while dominating the second half. Anthony Brown had 14 points and a game-high eight rebounds for Pacific (5-11, 2-2), the three-time defending regular-season Big West champion. Pacific lost for just the second time in four years on its home floor in conference play. It was Pacific's most lopsided home loss since 1988. Irvine went on a 17-2 run midway through the second half to push its lead to 58-34 with 6:46 remaining, then finished the game with a 9-2 spurt. Pacific made just 13 of its 52 shots from the field while Irvine was 13 of 20 from the field in the second half to finish at 54 percent. There were three lead changes and the score was tied twice in the early going before Irvine began a 12-0 run midway through the first half to build a commanding 29-13 advantage. Pacific made only four of its first 23 field-goal attempts and shot 24.1 percent from the field in the first 20 minutes. But behind Brown, the Tigers finished the half on a 9-2 run to creep within 34-26 at the break. Pacific was back within six points after Anthony Esparza began the second half with an open-court steal and lay-up, but the Tigers never got any closer as Irvine quickly pulled away.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
